headerText: The `v-timeline` is useful for stylistically displaying chronological information.

usage.desc: `v-timeline`'s in their simplest form display a vertical timeline that should contain at least one `v-timeline-item`.

small.desc: The `small` prop allows alternate styles to provide a unique design.

icons.desc: Conditionally use icons within the `v-timeline-item`'s dot to provide additional context.

avatars.desc: Insert avatars into dots with use of the `icon` slot and `v-avatar`.

card.desc: If you place a `v-card` inside of a `v-timeline-item`, a caret will appear on the side of the card.

color.desc: Colored dots create visual breakpoints that make your timelines easier to read.

slot.desc: The **opposite** slot provides an additional layer of customization within your timelines.

alert.desc: `dense` timelines position all content to the right. In this example, `v-alert` replaces the card to provide a different design.

reverse.desc: You can reverse the direction of the timeline items by using the `reverse` prop. This works both in default and `dense` mode.

advanced.desc: Modular components allow you to create highly customized solutions that just work.

v-timeline.alignTop: Align caret and dot of timeline items to the top
v-timeline.dense: Hide opposite slot content, and position all items to one side of timeline

v-timeline-item.left: Explicitly set the item to a left orientation
v-timeline-item.right: Explicitly set the item to a right orientation
